headline: Microsoft’s $9.7 Billion AI Cloud Deal Might Change the Case for Investing in IREN (IREN)
summary: Microsoft recently announced a $9.7 billion, five-year AI cloud services agreement with IREN, focused on deploying advanced GPUs powered by renewable energy infrastructure. This landmark deal marks IREN’s expansion from bitcoin mining into high-demand AI data center services, leveraging its large-scale power capacity and direct partnerships with tech industry leaders. We’ll explore how this multi-billion dollar Microsoft partnership accelerates IREN’s transition to AI infrastructure and...

headline: Why Google’s Soaring Stock Is Defying Fears of an AI Bubble
summary: A lot of value was unlocked when the company beat back the government’s breakup efforts. Now, Google is making strides in the AI race while its core business offers it financial flexibility.

content.title: Why Google’s Soaring Stock Is Defying Fears of an AI Bubble
content.summary: A lot of value was unlocked when the company beat back the government’s breakup efforts. Now, Google is making strides in the AI race while its core business offers it financial flexibility.

headline: Tech Weekly: Nvidia pushes back on 'AI bubble', Microsoft celebrates
summary:
STORY: From Nvidia pushing back on worries about an AI bubble... to Microsoft's big anniversary.

This is Tech Weekly.

:: Tech Weekly

There is no AI bubble, but rather a tipping point.

That was the word from Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang.

He believes the computing his company specializes in will come to be part of everything - from writing code to running legions of robots.

Huang spoke after the chip giant beat expectations once again with stronger profit and sales.

But a growing number of market skeptics - including The Big Short's Michael Burry - are concerned the only way off a tipping point is down.

Foxconn caught the eye when it presented its new 'Model A' electric vehicle in Taiwan.

Chairman Young Liu said it was designed by Japanese engineers and the car will eventually be made in the country, too.

He also announced a partnership with OpenAI to design and build AI hardware.

Court filings alleged Meta shut down internal research into the mental effects of using Facebook.

That after finding casual evidence its products harmed users' mental health.

Meta documents obtained through discovery showed the company's research project involved the firm's scientists working with survey firm Nielsen to study the effects of 'deactivating' Facebook.

Intenal documents showed people who stopped using the site for a week reported lower feelings of depression and anxiety.

A Meta spokesperson said the study was stopped because its methodology was flawed.

The filing was made by a law firm suing Meta and other tech giants on behalf of school districts around the U.S.

Waymo's new Zeekr robotaxi model was seen at a charging station in California.

It was out for testing before the driverless service starts its expansion into San Diego next year.

The new Zeekr model was developed with Chinese automaker Geely

Companies like Waymo and Tesla are investing billions into self-driving technology.

And Microsoft's famous Windows operating system hit 40 years old.

The first version was released under Micorsoft co-founder Bill Gates on November 20, 1985.

Experts believe it eventually helped set the world standard for computing.

The system is now on its eleventh iteration, known as Windows 11.

headline: Tracking IREN’s Evolving Narrative Amid Partnerships and AI Cloud Transformation
summary: Analysts have recently revised IREN’s consensus fair value estimate upward, increasing the price target from around $74 to $81 per share. This change reflects heightened confidence in the company’s opportunities, supported by rapid progress in AI cloud infrastructure and high-profile partnerships with major technology firms. Stay tuned to see how ongoing developments and market sentiment may continue to impact IREN’s evolving investment story. Stay updated as the Fair Value for IREN shifts by...

headline: Alibaba’s AI Arm Surges 34% While China Commerce Bounces Back
summary: The company posted a 16% rise in Chinese e-commerce revenue for the period, suggesting it was faring well in a three-way battle with JD.com Inc. and Meituan.  The strong results are likely to encourage investors betting on Alibaba as a leader in artificial intelligence development.  The company has accelerated the release of AI models, culminating in the relaunch of its flagship Qwen mobile app — an effort to replicate the success of OpenAI’s ChatGPT that got off to a fast start this month.

content.title: Alibaba’s AI Arm Surges 34% While China Commerce Bounces Back
content.summary: The company posted a 16% rise in Chinese e-commerce revenue for the period, suggesting it was faring well in a three-way battle with JD.com Inc. and Meituan. The company has accelerated the release of AI models, culminating in the relaunch of its flagship Qwen mobile app — an effort to replicate the success of OpenAI’s ChatGPT that got off to a fast start this month.

headline: What SoftBank's Sagging Stock Price Says About AI Sentiment
summary: The AI stock frenzy is cooling, and SoftBank is taking it on the chin.  In all, more than $100 billion in market value has been erased.  The roller-coaster ride likely reflects shifting investor sentiment about artificial intelligence, and particularly about ChatGPT maker OpenAI, to which SoftBank has committed more than $31 billion this year.
